newsitem.title: USA: CSX gets $4.8 bln for Conrail deal.
newsitem.headline: CSX gets $4.8 bln for Conrail deal.

text.p: CSX Corp said on Tuesday that it set up a five-year, $4.8-billion financing arrangement for its proposed acquisition of Conrail Inc.
Lead banks are NationsBank Corp, BankAmerica Corp, Bank of Nova Scotia and Chase Manhattan Corp. Chase Securities is administrative agent.
"Completing this arrangement clearly underscores our commitment to the merger," CSX Chairman John Snow said.
The leading transportation companies announced they would combine on Oct. 15, with Conrail being absorbed in a cash and stock deal worth $8.4 billion, or $92.50 per Conrail share.
Under the financing deal, each lead bank has agreed to commit $1.2 billion of the $4.8 billion financing with syndication to a consortium of leading financial institutions.

"We are very encouraged by the early response we are getting from key constituents, including shippers and public officials," Snow said. "We are anxious to work with other carriers in the region, and so far have reached out in that regard to Norfolk Southern (Corp ) as the other leading carrier in the area."
Norfolk Southern is viewed as a major rival of the merged CSX, which plans to move to Philadelphia from Richmond, Va.
"We are intent on reaching agreements with Norfolk Southern and other carriers and having them completed prior to filing our application with the Surface Transportation Board," Snow said.

The merger will create a leading freight transportation and logistics company with revenues exceeding $14 billion, CSX said. It will offer single-line rail service opportunities to shippers and receivers in 22 states from Chicago, Boston and New York to Miami and New Orleans, the company said.
Shares of CSX were down 5/8 at 46, and Conrail was down 1/2 at 84-1/2.
